shortlist.name: Starsong (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 2.68 exchange (clear market leader, strong support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple recent placings and wins, holding form well. Trained by Michael Appleby, who is reliable at this level. No signs of regression in recent runs and market support confirms expectations.

shortlist.name: Barnsnape Boy
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 3.95 exchange (solid second-favorite, value relative to form)
shortlist.rationale: Recent wins and placings indicate current good form. Trainer Jim Boyle is adept with Brighton runners. Odds are fair for a horse with two wins in last four starts, suggesting he remains competitive at this level.

shortlist.name: Recon Mission (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 4.1 exchange (well-respected in market, not far behind main favorite)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent at this grade with several recent placings and a win within last six starts. Tony Carroll is a notable trainer at Brighton. Form is reliable and odds are competitive for a horse with proven ability at the trip.

shortlist.name: Fierce Fortitude
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite; 10/11 SBK, 2.22 exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with progressive placings (4th, 3rd, 2nd) indicates readiness to win. Top connections: David Egan is a leading jockey and Kevin Philippart de Foy is in good form. Current odds reflect strong market confidence and value for a likely winner.

shortlist.name: Cosmo Goodspeed (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice; 7/5 SBK, 2.6 exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows improvement (0, 4, 2) with a close second last time out. Trainer Brian Meehan is respected and the odds indicate solid market support. Well placed to challenge the favourite if repeating latest effort.

shortlist.name: Arvana Belle (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 5/4 (exchange 3.05), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is progressive, with a win and a close second in last two starts, indicating peak condition. Connections are solid and the market support is significant, suggesting confidence from informed sources. No major negatives in profile.

shortlist.name: Receding (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in the market at 4/1 (exchange 5).
shortlist.rationale: Form is less exposed but improved last time and represents a respected yard. Market position suggests potential for further progress and connections are capable at this level.

shortlist.name: Dalmally
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 3.25 exchange (clear market leader, strong support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, including a close 2nd and 3rd in last four starts. Proven at this level and holding form well, with a top jockey booked. Market support indicates strong confidence.

shortlist.name: Love You Back (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/5 SBK, 2.78 exchange (solid favourite, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, including a close second last time. Connections are reliable at Brighton and the odds reflect strong market support. No signs of decline in form and should be competitive at this level.

shortlist.name: Just Adair
shortlist.odds_note: 15/8 SBK, 3.3 exchange (well-backed, clear contender)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with back-to-back wins, indicating improvement and readiness. Jockey/trainer combination is respected, and odds are competitive for a horse with winning momentum. No major negatives in recent runs.

shortlist.name: Al Khawaneej River (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 3.4 exchange (short odds, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple placings and a win in recent form. Trainer is capable at this level and the odds suggest market respect. Has shown ability to handle similar company and conditions.

shortlist.name: Gone Rogue (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 4.7 Exchange (market leader)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a competitive 2nd last time out. Connections are in good order and the odds reflect strong market support. No major improvement needed; profile fits for this class and trip.

shortlist.name: Toussarok
shortlist.odds_note: 16/5 SBK, 5 Exchange (solid second favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and two further placings in last four starts indicate reliable current form. Trainer excels with similar types at Brighton and the odds are competitive. Proven at this level and distance.

shortlist.name: Desert Beauty
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 6.2 Exchange (third in market)
shortlist.rationale: Recent runner-up and winner in last five starts, showing ability to compete at this grade. Jockey booking is notable and odds offer fair value. No signs of decline in form.

shortlist.name: Rovinia
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 4.1 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with three consecutive placings, suggesting reliability and readiness to win. Market support is strong, and the trainer/jockey combination is respected. No signs of needing major improvement; profile fits a likely winner at this level.

shortlist.name: Upper Hand (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 5.3 exchange (well-supported, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form figures show improvement, with a close second last time out. Hollie Doyle is a top jockey booking, and the horse is peaking at the right time. Odds indicate solid market confidence.

shortlist.name: Hannah's Return
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 6.2 exchange (well-fancied, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Multiple wins last season and a strong overall strike rate. Although returning from a break, the profile suggests class and ability at this level. Odds are competitive, and the horse does not require major improvement to feature.

shortlist.name: Eat Pray Run (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 1/25 SBK, 1.08 exchange (overwhelming favourite, extremely short odds)
shortlist.rationale: Eat Pray Run (Ire) is trained by a top Irish trainer, Joseph O'Brien, and ridden by a capable jockey. The horse's recent form (0, 4) suggests improvement last time out and is the only runner with any positive finishing position. The odds are extremely short, indicating strong market confidence and a lack of credible opposition. No major improvement is needed to win this race given the field.

shortlist.name: Kranjcar (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 13/8 SBK, 3.6 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in outstanding form with four consecutive wins, indicating peak condition. The Boughey stable is in good order and the jockey booking is positive. Odds are short but justified by recent dominance and consistency at this level.

shortlist.name: Impressor (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 4.1 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a win and two places from last three starts, suggesting upward trajectory. Consistent at this grade and market support is notable. Connections are capable and the horse is reliable for the frame.

shortlist.name: Ey Up Its Jazz
shortlist.odds_note: Strong market support (exchange 2.82, sbk 15/4); clear favourite.
shortlist.rationale: Comes here in peak form, winning 2 of last 4 starts including latest. Consistent profile, proven at this level, and market leader. No signs of regression and connections are in good form.

shortlist.name: Arkenstaar
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market (exchange 4.2, sbk 3/1).
shortlist.rationale: Recent runner-up effort signals return to form after a win two starts back. Consistent at this class, reliable connections, and market respect. Should be competitive if repeating latest effort.

shortlist.name: Pisanello (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Third in market (exchange 5, sbk 4/1).
shortlist.rationale: Consistent placer with three consecutive third-place finishes. Trainer/jockey combo is strong at this venue. Lacks recent win but always thereabouts and holds each-way claims if race falls apart up front.

shortlist.name: Impartiality
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite; 11/8 (SBK), 3.15 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with three wins and two seconds in last six starts, indicating sustained high-level form. Recent form figures suggest reliability and ability to compete at this level. Current odds reflect strong market confidence.

shortlist.name: Jannas Journey (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second favourite; 11/4 (SBK), 3.55 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Outstanding recent form with seven wins from last eight starts, showing remarkable consistency and progression. Connections are in good form and the horse is proven at this level. Odds are fair for a prolific winner.

shortlist.name: Spioradalta
shortlist.odds_note: Solid contender; 4/1 (SBK), 5.1 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with three consecutive wins, suggesting improvement and suitability to current conditions. Connections are respected and odds offer value relative to recent achievements.

shortlist.name: Eternal Sunshine
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3.5 Exchange (clear favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple wins and placings, indicating peak condition. Trainer Jim Goldie is reliable at this venue, and the odds reflect strong confidence from both bookmakers and exchange. No signs of decline in latest runs.

shortlist.name: Corolla Point (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 4.3 Exchange (second favourite, well-backed)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with two wins in last four starts, including a recent victory after a short break. Trainer and jockey combination is in good form, and odds are competitive for a runner with upward trajectory.

shortlist.name: Stirrup Cup
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 4.0 exchange (clear market leader)
shortlist.rationale: Returned to winning form last time out after a string of below-par efforts, suggesting a return to peak. The stable is respected at this level and the market support is notable. Recent win indicates readiness and current form is strongest among the field.

shortlist.name: Harb
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 5.6 exchange (solid second-favorite)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with a recent win two starts ago and a respectable fourth last time. Connections are in form and the horse has shown ability to compete at this level. Odds reflect strong market respect and reliability.

shortlist.name: Both Of Us (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 1/1 (SBK), 2.02 (Exchange) – clear favourite, strong market support
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with two wins and a second from last three starts, representing a top trainer in George Boughey. Consistency and recent improvement are clear, and current odds reflect strong confidence from the market. No signs of regression in recent runs, and connections are in excellent form.

shortlist.name: Vampire Slayer (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 (SBK), 5.5 (Exchange) – solid second choice, holding value
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two seconds in last three starts, suggesting readiness to win. Proven stamina and competitive at this level. Jockey booking is positive, and odds are fair for a runner with strong place credentials and potential to go one better.

shortlist.name: Centara (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 5/6 (exchange 2.06), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Centara has outstanding recent form, winning four of the last five and finishing second last time, indicating sustained peak performance. Trained by Paul Nicholls, a top jumps trainer, and with market support, this runner is the most solid on both form and connections. No signs of regression and no need for major improvement.

shortlist.name: Breaking Cover (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market at 6/4 (exchange 3.1), well clear of outsiders.
shortlist.rationale: Breaking Cover is in excellent form, winning three of the last four starts and placing in the other. The horse is progressive and comes from a respected yard. The odds reflect strong support and the form is consistent, making this runner a legitimate threat to the favourite.

shortlist.name: Dickens (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite; 7/5 SBK, 3.1 exchange
shortlist.rationale: Comes in with excellent recent form, winning 3 of last 4 starts and placing in all but one. Connections are in good order and odds reflect strong market support. No signs of decline in form and profile fits a progressive, reliable winner.

shortlist.name: Sassified (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Solid second choice; 3/1 SBK, 4.1 exchange
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and two placings in last four runs. Trained by a respected yard and showing reliability at this level. Odds indicate genuine market respect and form suggests readiness to compete for the win.

shortlist.name: Gavin
shortlist.odds_note: Viable contender; 9/4 SBK, 4.6 exchange
shortlist.rationale: Has been knocking on the door with two consecutive runner-up finishes and a win earlier in the campaign. Consistency and competitive form make him a strong shortlist candidate, though may need slight improvement to beat Dickens.

shortlist.name: John Barbour
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite; 6/5 (SBK), 2.58 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple wins and places in recent form, trained by an in-form yard and partnered by a reliable jockey. The odds reflect strong market confidence and he sets the standard on recent achievements.

shortlist.name: Jaminska (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice; 7/2 (SBK), 4.4 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form including a win and a good second last time out. Proven ability to compete at this level and represents a stable with a good record at the track. Odds are fair for an each-way or win contender.

shortlist.name: At The Oche (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Third in market; 5/2 (SBK), 5 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with a win on debut, then disappointing next time but from a respected yard. Market support suggests ability and potential for improvement, though needs to bounce back from last run.

shortlist.name: Tropical Speed (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite; 11/8 SBK, 2.68 exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings and a win this season. Sean Bowen is a top jockey, and Andy Irvine’s runners are reliable at this level. Current odds reflect strong market support and form credentials.

shortlist.name: Testflight
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice; 16/5 SBK, 3.85 exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form with two wins and a runner-up finish in last five starts. Connections are capable, and odds indicate genuine market respect. No major negatives in profile.

shortlist.name: Bagheera Ginge
shortlist.odds_note: 9/5 SBK, 3.25 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two solid placed efforts and a close third last time. Trained by the Twiston-Davies team, who are reliable at this level, and partnered by an experienced jockey. No major negatives in profile and holds the best combination of form and current odds among the principals.

shortlist.name: Hold Your Fort (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 3.95 exchange (well-supported, second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is strong, with a win and two placed efforts in last four starts. Reliable at this level and has shown the ability to bounce back from a fall. Market position reflects genuine chance and profile is progressive enough for this grade.

shortlist.name: Stans The Man (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 4.2 exchange (third in betting, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Won twice earlier this season and retains potential to bounce back after two below-par runs in stronger company. Connections are capable and the horse has proven winning form at this level. Market respect suggests a return to form is possible.

shortlist.name: The Height Of Fame
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 11/10 (2.4 exchange), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer at this level, holding form with recent placed efforts. Connections are reliable and the horse is proven at the track. No signs of decline and market support is strong, suggesting confidence from connections and punters.

shortlist.name: Despereaux (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market at 5/1 (4.5 exchange), solid support.
shortlist.rationale: Recent form is solid with multiple placings and a win last season. Trainer is adept at readying horses for this type of contest. The latest run can be forgiven after a break, and odds offer value against the favourite.

shortlist.name: Universal Story (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 13/8 SBK, 2.94 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Comes here off a last-time-out win, showing clear progression and ability to handle this grade. Consistent recent form figures and now proven at the trip. Market support is strong, indicating confidence from connections and punters.

shortlist.name: Spectacular Style
shortlist.odds_note: 15/8 SBK, 3.15 exchange (well-fancied, close in market to favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent form with a win two starts back and placed efforts prior. Reliable profile for this level, and the booking of an in-form jockey is a positive. Market position suggests strong chance if repeating best.

shortlist.name: Big Win (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 3.9 exchange (third choice in market, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced and open to improvement after three starts. Trainer and jockey combination is respected. While yet to win, the horse has shown enough promise to be considered a danger if progressing again.

shortlist.name: Mayfair Market
shortlist.odds_note: 15/4 SBK, 4.8 exchange (solid market support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a 3rd and 4th in last two starts, indicating fitness and reliability. The jockey is in good form and the odds reflect strong market confidence. Connections are respected and the horse is proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Art Gallery (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 5.7 exchange (well-fancied debutant, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Debutant with top jockey Oisin Murphy booked, suggesting stable confidence. Trainer James Ferguson is adept with newcomers. Market support is notable for a first-time starter, indicating positive reports from the yard.

shortlist.name: Tago Mago (Usa)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 5.9 exchange (prominent in betting, respected connections)
shortlist.rationale: Another debutant with strong market position. Jamie Osborne is capable with juveniles and the odds suggest the horse is expected to be competitive. No negative signals from connections or market.

shortlist.name: Rose Of Honour (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite at 11/10 (exchange 1.99), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Impressive debut winner, suggesting above-average ability. Top connections (Tate/Ryan) and market support reinforce confidence. No need for major improvement based on debut performance.

shortlist.name: Spitzbergen (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Second choice in market at 5/2 (exchange 3.9), clear of outsiders.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent profile with multiple placed efforts in stronger company. Proven reliability and strong connections (Crisford/Mitchell). Should be competitive if repeating recent form.

shortlist.name: Phoenix Moon (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong market support (exchange 3.4, sbk 16/5)
shortlist.rationale: Comes here off a win, showing progressive form and consistency. Top jockey booking and solid trainer stats. Odds indicate clear market confidence and value for a runner in peak form.

shortlist.name: Grace Angel
shortlist.odds_note: 15/8 SBK, 3.4 exchange (market leader, solid support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes, indicating readiness to win. Proven at this level and holding form well. Jockey and trainer both in good current form. No signs of decline and well positioned by market.

shortlist.name: Thankuappreciate
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 3.85 exchange (clear second choice)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form shows improvement with two strong placed efforts. Profile suggests a competitive chance at this grade. Odds reflect genuine market respect and connections capable at this level.

shortlist.name: My Ambition (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 3.75 exchange (clear favourite, solid market support)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a win and a place in last two starts, suggesting peak fitness. Top jockey booking in Oisin Murphy is a positive. Odds reflect strong market confidence and connections are in good order. No need for major improvement to win here.

shortlist.name: Back From Dubai (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 SBK, 7.2 exchange (solid second tier in market)
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent profile at this level, regularly hitting the frame and has recent winning form. Suited by track and trip, and connections have a good record at Southwell. Odds offer fair value for a proven performer who does not require significant improvement.

shortlist.name: Luminoso (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3.65 exchange (clear market leader, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a promising debut second and fair fifth next time; represents a trainer in good form and is well supported in the market, indicating strong confidence. No need for major improvement to contend.

shortlist.name: Stellenbosch (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/4 SBK, 3.5 exchange (solidly in the top market tier)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple placings at this level; proven reliability and strong connections. Market support and solid recent form suggest another bold showing is likely.

shortlist.name: Goldie Trickett (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 4.3 exchange (well-fancied, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Improved from debut to finish fourth last time; represents a top yard and has scope for further progress. Market position reflects stable confidence and realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Silky Robin (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 SBK, 6.0 exchange (solid market support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in outstanding form with three consecutive wins, indicating peak condition. Top jockey booking and trainer in form. Odds reflect strong market confidence and recent consistency at this level.

shortlist.name: Ottawa
shortlist.odds_note: 5/1 SBK, 5.7 exchange (well found in market, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Recent runner-up finish signals a return to form. Consistent profile and top young jockey booked. Market support suggests connections expect a bold run.

shortlist.name: The Real Mckay (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 5.3 exchange (current favourite, strong market position)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent efforts in similar company and holds the best market position. Connections have been competitive at this level and the horse is holding form well.

shortlist.name: Final Melody (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 3/1 SBK, 4.6 exchange (solid market support, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a recent 2nd place finish, indicating current form and improvement. Market support is strong, and the jockey booking is notable for this yard. Connections are capable and the horse is not exposed compared to rivals.

shortlist.name: Award Ceremony (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 3.9 exchange (well-fancied, clear market respect)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with multiple recent placings in similar company. Represents top connections and is holding form well. The market rates this runner as a leading contender.

shortlist.name: Billie Frechette (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 2.5, SBK 85/40 (clear favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two wins and two seconds in last four starts, indicating peak condition. Connections are strong, and odds reflect market confidence. No signs of decline in form, making her the most reliable contender.

shortlist.name: Alba Chiara (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 3.65, SBK 5/2 (solid second favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Recent win and consistent placed efforts suggest improvement and readiness. Jockey/trainer combination is respected, and odds offer reasonable value for a progressive profile.

shortlist.name: Fortuna Vera (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Exchange 4, SBK 3/1 (third choice, still prominent in market)
shortlist.rationale: Has won this season and regularly finishes in the frame. Trainer is high-profile, and recent form is competitive. Odds are fair for a runner with proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Stars Will Shine (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/5 SBK, 3.5 Exchange (market leader)
shortlist.rationale: Solid recent third on debut, representing a top Irish yard with a leading jockey. The odds reflect strong market support and connections. No signs of needing major improvement; likely to progress naturally.

shortlist.name: Running Point (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/5 SBK, 3.8 Exchange (well-backed)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form (5th, then improved to 2nd), suggesting readiness to win. Odds indicate respect from the market. Connections are capable and the horse is proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Idiocracy (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 16/5 SBK, 4.1 Exchange (solid contender)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent performer with recent placed effort. Trained by a top stable and partnered by a strong jockey. Odds are competitive and reflect genuine winning chance without needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Celestial Siren (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 4.4 Exchange (in contention)
shortlist.rationale: Recent fourth after a string of respectable runs. Connections are reliable, and odds suggest the horse is considered a live chance. No evidence of declining form; could be suited by conditions.

shortlist.name: Diego El Queso (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite; 5/4 SBK, 2.24 exchange.
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with improved recent form figures, representing a top yard and leading jockey. Consistent and likely to be peaking at the right time. Current odds reflect strong market support and form credentials.

shortlist.name: Perfect Base (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/2 SBK, 5.5 exchange; solid second choice.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form, including a close third last time. Connections are in good form and the horse is holding its level. Odds offer fair value for a runner with proven ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Shelbourne Flyer (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Strong favourite; 11/4 (SBK), 2.5 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form, placed in last two starts and showing improvement. Top jockey booking and trainer in good form. Current odds reflect strong market support and realistic winning chance.

shortlist.name: Port Louis (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Joint-favourite; 11/4 (SBK), 4.5 (exchange)
shortlist.rationale: Has won this season and remains competitive at this level. Booking of leading jockey C. T. Keane is a positive. Market support suggests connections expect a bold run.

shortlist.name: Lunar Landscape
shortlist.odds_note: Strongly supported on exchange (2.8), clear market leader.
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with multiple placings, suggesting reliability and readiness to win. Market support is significant, indicating confidence from informed money. Connections are solid and the horse is proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Searcog (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: Well-backed (exchange 3.1), joint second-favorite.
shortlist.rationale: Recent win shows current improvement and ability to get the job done. Odds reflect strong market respect. Form profile is progressive and connections are capable.

shortlist.name: Faro Island
shortlist.odds_note: Short in the sportsbook (2/1), but exchange drift (3.85) suggests caution.
shortlist.rationale: Lightly raced with scope for improvement and a top jockey booked. Recent form is competitive and the market still rates chances highly. Connections are respected.

shortlist.name: Glenroyal (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/4 SBK, 3.5 exchange (clear market leader)
shortlist.rationale: Strong connections, recent win two starts ago, and market support indicate peak form. Joseph O'Brien is a top trainer and the horse's profile fits a likely winner at this level.

shortlist.name: Qamari (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/1 SBK, 3.9 exchange (significant exchange support, much shorter than fixed odds)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form, lightly raced profile, and notable exchange support suggest improvement is expected. Trainer is capable at this level and the market move is significant.

shortlist.name: Rakki
shortlist.odds_note: 6/4 SBK, 2.34 Exchange (clear favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a solid third last time out, trained by top yard Mullins and ridden by leading jockey Townend. Current odds reflect strong market support and connections.

shortlist.name: First Ascent (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 6 Exchange (second favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Represents the powerful Elliott-Kennedy combination. Despite lacking recent form, market support and connections suggest readiness and ability. Not an outsider by odds.

shortlist.name: Hobart (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 SBK, 6 Exchange (third in market)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form figures show improvement and consistency, including a second and third in last two starts. Odds indicate genuine market respect, and does not require major improvement.

shortlist.name: No Big Deal (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 10/3 SBK, 3.15 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Returned from a break with a solid third last time, showing improvement and fitness. Consistent profile, best recent form in the field, and market leader. Connections in good order.

shortlist.name: Spanish John (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 3.9 exchange (well-backed, second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Placed on both starts this season, showing reliability and competitiveness at this level. Trainer in form and horse holding condition well.

shortlist.name: Woodland Adventure (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 7/5 SBK, 2.94 Exchange (clear favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form with three consecutive wins, representing top connections. Odds reflect strong market support and recent form is unexposed at this level. No signs of decline and should be at or near peak fitness.

shortlist.name: Dolce N' Milana (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 3.3 Exchange (second favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Represents the leading Mullins/Townend combination. Recent form is progressive and the odds indicate market respect. Connections excel with improving types and this runner is likely to be competitive.

shortlist.name: Walks The Talk (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 SBK, 3.9 Exchange
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form and competitive odds suggest a runner with solid claims. Trainer is adept at placing horses in winnable spots and the horse has shown ability to stay on well in similar company.

shortlist.name: Live To Laugh (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 16/5 SBK, 4.4 exchange (market leader, solid support)
shortlist.rationale: Best recent form in the field with a promising 4th last time, showing improvement and race fitness. Connections are reliable, and odds reflect strong market confidence. No major improvement needed, and profile fits for a winner at this level.

shortlist.name: Nettuno Italia (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/2 SBK, 4.2 exchange (well-backed, close to favourite)
shortlist.rationale: Recent 5th suggests potential for further progress, and odds indicate market respect. Trainer is capable at this level, and the horse has shown enough ability to be competitive without needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Mellem (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/2 SBK, 4.1 exchange (solid value, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with a 2nd and 7th in last two starts, indicating reliability and fitness. Connections are respected, and odds suggest genuine winning chance in a modest field.

shortlist.name: Quantum Quest (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 16/5 SBK, 4.3 Exchange (market leader, solid support)
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile with a recent win after consistent placed efforts; trained by a top yard and partnered by a strong jockey. Form suggests peak fitness and readiness for this grade.

shortlist.name: Its Not Over Yet (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 13/2 SBK, 4.2 Exchange (well-backed, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Recent form includes two wins last season and a solid second last time, indicating return to form. Connections are reliable at this level and odds offer value for a horse with proven ability.

shortlist.name: Ballyglass Beauty (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 8/1 SBK, 4.2 Exchange (supported on exchange, not a longshot)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent placings and competitive odds suggest market respect. Has shown ability to stay on in similar contests and is fit from recent runs.

shortlist.name: Westport Cove (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/5 (SBK), 1.9 (Exchange) – clear favourite, strong market support
shortlist.rationale: Comes from the top Mullins yard with Paul Townend booked, both highly reliable at this level. Recent form is excellent, winning on seasonal return and following up with a solid second. Consistent profile, proven at the grade, and market leader for good reason.

shortlist.name: King Of Kingsfield (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 11/10 (SBK), 2.34 (Exchange) – clear second choice, well clear of outsiders
shortlist.rationale: Progressive profile, winning both starts this season for the powerful Elliott/Kennedy combination. Has been highly consistent and is the only realistic threat to the favourite based on current form and connections. Odds reflect strong win chance.

shortlist.name: Cobra Queen (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 5/2 SBK, 3.95 exchange (solid favourite, not an outsider)
shortlist.rationale: Arrives in peak form, having won last time and placed in two of three prior starts. Represents a top stable and has a progressive profile, suggesting further improvement is likely. Odds are short but justified by recent consistency and upward trajectory.

shortlist.name: Betty Dutton (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 9/4 SBK, 3.5 exchange (well-supported, clear market principal)
shortlist.rationale: Ultra-consistent with multiple seconds and a recent fall when still in contention. Strong form in context of this field, and market support reflects her reliability. Connections are in good form and she is overdue a win.

shortlist.name: Howya Luveen (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 6/1 SBK, 3.15 exchange (not an outsider, exchange price notably strong)
shortlist.rationale: Returned from a break to win last time out, indicating improvement and fitness. Exchange price is notably strong relative to sportsbook, suggesting smart money support. Recent win shows readiness and ability at this level.

shortlist.name: Shadys Lady (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 8/11 SBK, 2.0 exchange (clear favourite, strong market support)
shortlist.rationale: Runner-up on debut, representing a trainer-jockey combination with a solid record in bumpers. The form figure '2-' indicates immediate ability and readiness, and the horse is a clear market leader, suggesting strong confidence from connections and punters. No evidence of needing major improvement.

shortlist.name: Ozark's Walk (Ire)
shortlist.odds_note: 4/1 SBK, 5.0 exchange (solid second choice in market)
shortlist.rationale: Consistent recent form with two runner-up finishes from last three starts, indicating reliability and fitness. Odds reflect genuine market respect. No sign of regression or need for significant improvement; proven at this level.

shortlist.name: Centauri
shortlist.odds_note: Expected to be prominent in the market based on top connections and typical French betting patterns.
shortlist.rationale: Centauri is partnered by leading jockey Maxime Guyon and trained by Christophe Ferland, both highly respected in French racing. In the absence of published form, this combination is a strong indicator of intent and market confidence, especially in French maidens where top connections often dominate. No evidence suggests the horse needs major improvement.

shortlist.name: Royal Chapel
shortlist.odds_note: Likely to be well found in the market due to Pasquier and Clement partnership.
shortlist.rationale: Royal Chapel boasts the services of Stephane Pasquier, a top jockey, and the Clement stable, which is known for strong results with juveniles and maidens. This profile typically attracts market support and signals readiness. No negative form indicators are present.

shortlist.name: Agiota (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Should be among the market leaders given the trainer's Bordeaux record.
shortlist.rationale: Agiota is trained by M. Delcher Sanchez, who has a strong record at Bordeaux, and ridden by Clement Lecoeuvre, a capable jockey. The connections suggest the horse is expected to be competitive without needing significant improvement.

shortlist.name: Ange Du Mesnil (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Consistently trades as a market leader for this yard; not an outsider on current books.
shortlist.rationale: Represents the top Lageneste & Macaire stable, which is highly respected in French jumps racing. The booking of Kilian Dubourg is notable, and this team is known for strong strike rates in similar contests. Market support is significant, and the connections rarely run horses here without strong claims.

shortlist.name: Macalister (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Short in the market; not considered a longshot.
shortlist.rationale: Francois Nicolle is a leading trainer at Bordeaux, and Bryony Frost is a high-profile jockey booking, suggesting intent. The stable's runners are typically well-prepared for these events, and market signals indicate this is one of the main contenders.

shortlist.name: Rose Corbon (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Prominent in early betting; not an outsider.
shortlist.rationale: Another from the powerful Lageneste & Macaire yard, with Johnny Charron a reliable stable jockey. The stable often runs multiple strong chances in these races, and Rose Corbon is attracting market attention, suggesting readiness and ability.

shortlist.name: Ferrum (Pol)
shortlist.odds_note: Represents the top French jumps yard (Lageneste & Macaire), often well-supported in these conditions events. Market likely to have this runner prominent.
shortlist.rationale: Ferrum is trained by the leading French jumps stable, which consistently produces winners at Bordeaux and similar provincial tracks. The booking of Kilian Dubourg, a reliable jockey for the yard, further strengthens the case. In the absence of published form, the connections alone make this runner a standout, especially as outsiders are excluded.

shortlist.name: Royal Louis Has (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Stable is respected in French provincial jumps races; likely to be among the market leaders.
shortlist.rationale: Royal Louis Has is from a respected jumps yard and has a capable jockey booked. While form is not provided, the trainer's record at this level and typical market support for such runners suggest strong competitiveness. Exclusion of longshots further highlights this runner as a logical contender.

shortlist.name: Crown Du Berlais (Fr)
shortlist.odds_note: Represents the top French jumps yard; likely to be prominent in the market based on connections.
shortlist.rationale: Trained by the leading Lageneste & Macaire team, who have a high strike rate in French jumps racing and often target Bordeaux with their better prospects. Johnny Charron is a reliable stable jockey. In a field lacking exposed form and with no clear market outsiders, this combination stands out on stable/jockey strength and typical market support for this yard.
